Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of declining coronavirus death rates in determining the epidemic status of COVID-19 in the United States.
Understate: The claim may understate the importance of the prevalence of the disease in determining its epidemic status, according to the CDC.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the CDC has made no announcements regarding COVID-19's epidemic classification.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that declining death rates alone can determine the epidemic status of COVID-19, which is a problematic assumption according to the CDC.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the declining death rates, such as improved medical treatments or changes in testing and reporting methods.
